alert.note: Alert for Henderson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 15 at 5:56AM EST until December 16 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Henderson County in western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 548 AM EST, Runoff from pre-dawn heavy rain will continue to cause flooding of low-lying areas throughout the Mud and Bat Fork Creek basins this morning. This is especially likely near Erkwood Drive, East Caswell Street and the intersection of South Church and Main Streets. Watch for developing high water conditions between South King Street and Chadwick Ave as well. Flooding of low-lying areas in Jackson Park is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hendersonville, Flat Rock, Laurel Park, Valley Hill, East Flat Rock and Crab Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
